summary:
We show that the reduced von Neumann algebras of the free orthogonal and free
unitary quantum groups have the Haagerup approximation property. Using this
result and a Haagerup-type inequality for these quantum groups due to Vergnioux
(J. Operator Theory 57, 303-324 (2007)), we also show that the reduced
C$^\ast$-algebras of the free orthogonal and free unitary quantum groups have
the metric approximation property.

3. The Haagerup Approximation Property for Compact
Quantum Groups of Kac Type
In this section, we discuss the Haagerup approximation property in the
context of CQGs G = (A, ∆) of Kac type, and prove some general results
on constructing normal completely positive maps on L∞ (G) from states on
A.
We will say that a CQG G = (A, ∆) of Kac type has the Haagerup
approximation property (HAP) if the finite von Neumann algebra (L∞ (G), h)
has the HAP, as defined in Section 1.
Remark 3.1. At this point, it is worthwhile to mention that the HAP for a
finite von Neumann algebra (M, τ ) does not actually depend on the particular choice of trace τ . I.e., if τ ′ : M → C is another faithful, normal, finite
trace, then (M, τ ′ ) also has the HAP. Furthermore, in the definition of the
HAP, the requirement that the maps Φλ : M → M be τ -preserving can be
relaxed to τ ◦ Φλ ≤ τ , and this yields the same class of von Neumann algebras [22]. From the trace-independence of the HAP, it is easily deduced that
the HAP is an invariant for the isomorphism class of a finite von Neumann
algebra.
